answers.answer: Well the obvious:1. What's causing the reduced vision.2. What do you see that makes you think she has diabetes or hypertension3. Does "pressure" mean she has glaucoma4. What can be done to help5 What is the prognosis6. Am I at increased risk as her daughterJCH MD

question: My 85-yr-old mother saw her Ophthalmologist on SEPT 2.  I had noticed a distinct difference between her left & right eye a few days before & she'd been complaining about her right eye, despite just having gotten new glasses.  Doctor said the right eye was very bad & said there was pressure from behind the eye.  He gave her a script to see her PCP and wanted her blood pressure checked, as well as testing for diabetes.While she was happy to accept an appt for SEPT 11, I was not.  Her appt is now for SEPT 4 and I will be going to that appt with her.  Though not sure you will be able to respond prior to that, would like to know what questions I should be asking her PCP and/or Ophthalmologist.  Thank you.
title: Pressure Behind One Eye
